meanings.definition: The act of structuring or organizing something.
meanings.sent1: Her structuration of the project plan was meticulous and detailed.
meanings.sent2: The structuration of the company's hierarchy was essential for smooth operations.
meanings.sent3: The structuration of the picnic baskets made the ants' job easier!
meanings.sent4: The structuration of the team resembled a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: His structuration of the Lego pieces into different colors made it easier to build.

meanings.definition: The process of creating or establishing a structure.
meanings.sent1: The structuration of the new building took months of planning and construction.
meanings.sent2: Effective structuration of the curriculum ensured student success.
meanings.sent3: The structuration of the sandcastle was a team effort.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a whirlwind of structuration, constantly organizing thoughts and ideas.
meanings.sent5: The structuration of the garden beds transformed the backyard into a beautiful oasis.

meanings.definition: The arrangement or formation of a system or framework.
meanings.sent1: The structuration of the data into categories simplified the analysis process.
meanings.sent2: Proper structuration of the essay's paragraphs improved its readability.
meanings.sent3: The structuration of the party seating plan led to some unexpected pairings.
meanings.sent4: The structuration of the city's roads was like a complex puzzle coming together.
meanings.sent5: The structuration of the bookshelves by genre made finding books much easier.
